annotation.summary: Describes a character archetype that channels cosmic forces to form spiritual bonds with allies, granting healing and empowerment abilities that grow stronger as the character deepens their chosen connection.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on specific abilities or spells granted by the chosen connection.
annotation.prerequisites: Must choose or possess a specific spiritual or cosmic connection to access related powers.

annotation.summary: At the first level, the character gains an increase to their Wisdom attribute as part of their class features.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be 1st level in the specified class.

annotation.summary: This rule increases a character's maximum hit points by a specified amount at first level and by the same amount at each subsequent level.
annotation.prerequisites: applies at character creation and each level-up

annotation.summary: The ability allows the caster to unleash damaging spells against foes while simultaneously strengthening and healing bonded allies through a shared vitality network.
annotation.action_economy: Standard action to cast spells; healing may occur as part of the same or a separate action depending on system rules.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an established vitality bond or network with allies; access to spellcasting abilities.

annotation.summary: The character’s bond influences their worldview and interpersonal approach, often making them a mediator who helps resolve conflicts among allies.
annotation.prerequisites: must have a defined connection or bond with other characters

annotation.summary: The character examines their surroundings to detect magical traces and gains insights related to their mystical connection.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to sense or detect magic

annotation.summary: The character strengthens their bond with allies through shared activities, enhancing mutual understanding and teamwork.
annotation.prerequisites: must have bonded allies or companions

annotation.summary: The character possesses a unique or unconventional understanding of their mystical or spiritual connection.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: The text suggests perceiving reality or the game world through the perspective granted by a personal or mystical connection.
annotation.prerequisites: must possess or establish a defined connection or bond

annotation.summary: The paragraph explains that mystics receive specific abilities as they progress in level, with each ability indicating the level at which it becomes available.
annotation.prerequisites: must be a mystic class

annotation.summary: At 1st level, a character gains not only their class features but also the benefits granted by their chosen ancestry and background as detailed in Chapter 2.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at 1st level and have selected an ancestry and background.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character gains specific proficiency ranks in certain statistics, and is considered untrained in all others unless improved by another feature.
annotation.prerequisites: 1st level

annotation.summary: The character gains training in one skill that is based on their specific connection or background.
annotation.prerequisites: must have a defined connection or background

annotation.summary: The character gains training in a number of extra skills equal to 3 plus their Intelligence modifier.
annotation.prerequisites: none

annotation.summary: The character has proficiency with simple weapons and unarmed attacks.
A level progression table for a mystic-style class, listing what features, feats, spells, and proficiency increases are gained at each level from 1 to 20.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this section describes character advancement rather than actions taken in play.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be of the mystic class; specific features unlock automatically at designated levels.

annotation.summary: Lists the core character creation and class features for a mystic-type character, including ancestry, background, attributes, proficiencies, and key mystical abilities.
annotation.prerequisites: Character creation; selection of ancestry and background

annotation.summary: This section lists character progression elements available at a certain level, including access to 2nd-rank spells, a general feat, group chat feature, improved Reflex proficiency, designation of signature spells, and a skill increase.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this entry describes level-based benefits rather than actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached the level or rank at which 2nd-rank spells and these features become available.

annotation.summary: At this level, the character gains access to 3rd-rank spells, selects an ancestry feat, applies attribute boosts, improves fortitude proficiency to expertise, and gains a skill increase.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached the level where 3rd-rank spells and fortitude expertise become available.

annotation.summary: A general feat available to expert spellcasters that grants access to 4th-rank spells and includes a skill increase.
The paragraph lists character progression elements available at a certain level, including access to 5th-rank spells, an ancestry feat, the resilient soul feature, and a skill increase.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached the level at which 5th-rank spells and these features become available.

annotation.summary: The paragraph lists character progression options, including attribute improvements, a mystic-related feat, and a skill-based feat.
annotation.prerequisites: character level or class features as defined by the rule system

annotation.summary: This section lists advancements available at 6th rank, including gaining a general feat, improving perception to expertise, increasing a skill, and achieving weapon expertise.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached 6th rank or level.

annotation.summary: At this level, a character gains access to 7th-rank spells, selects an ancestry feat, improves armor proficiency to expertise, gains a skill increase, and obtains weapon specialization.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; these are passive or level-based advancements rather than actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached the level where 7th-rank spells and these advancements become available.

annotation.summary: At 8th rank, a character gains access to 8th-rank spells, an attribute boost, a general feat, an increase in spellcasting mastery, and a skill increase.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this describes level-based progression benefits rather than actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached 8th rank or level in their class progression.

annotation.summary: Indicates that the character gains access to 9th-rank spells, an ancestry feat, and a skill increase at this level.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have reached the level granting 9th-rank spell access.

annotation.summary: The paragraph lists character advancement options that include increasing attributes, selecting a mystic feat, and choosing a skill feat.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at a level or stage that grants attribute boosts and feat selections.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, a character gains four free ability boosts that must be applied to different attributes, in addition to any boosts granted by their class.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at 1st level.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character gains specific proficiencies that reflect their initial training, as listed in the class description.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be 1st level in the class.

annotation.summary: Mystics derive their magical abilities from a supernatural bond with a cosmic force, which can take many forms such as devotion to a deity, embodiment of an idea, or channeling natural power.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be a mystic or possess a similar supernatural connection.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character selects a mystical connection that defines their spellcasting tradition, determines their spell list, grants an additional trained skill, provides unique epiphanies, and establishes a harmony that enhances healing effects through their vitality network.
annotation.action_economy: None (selection made at character creation, not during combat)
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at least 1st level to choose a connection.

annotation.summary: The character gains their chosen connection's initial epiphany spell, which is a focus spell. They receive a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which can be spent to cast focus spells. The focus pool refills during daily preparations or by using the Refocus activity for 10 minutes to reflect on their connection.
annotation.action_economy: Casting a focus spell costs 1 Focus Point; refocusing takes 10 minutes.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a chosen connection.

annotation.summary: Focus spells scale automatically with the caster’s level, do not use spell slots, and rely on a limited Focus Point pool that can be expanded through feats but never exceeds three points.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by specific focus spell; not defined in this paragraph.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast focus spells and possess a focus pool.

annotation.summary: The mystic can create a lasting bond with up to ten willing creatures through a 10-minute ritual performed while adjacent to them. The bond persists as long as both parties remain willing, and the mystic is always part of the bond without counting toward the limit.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be adjacent to a willing creature and have the ability to form bonds as a mystic

annotation.summary: The character can sense the general distance, direction, and condition (HP and consciousness state) of bonded allies, but this sense fails across planes or when blocked by certain magical or technological effects.
annotation.prerequisites: must have bonded creatures or allies

annotation.summary: The character possesses a vitality network that stores healing energy equal to 6 plus 4 Hit Points per level, which can be used to heal themselves or allies through the Transfer Vitality action.
annotation.action_economy: Transfer Vitality action (specific action type not detailed)
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the vitality network feature or ability

annotation.summary: At the start of each of your turns in combat, your vitality network automatically heals a set amount of Hit Points based on your spell DC proficiency, and it fully restores when you take the Refocus action.
annotation.action_economy: Automatic at the start of each turn; full restoration occurs when using the Refocus action.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires a vitality network and a spell DC proficiency rank (master or legendary for increased healing).

annotation.summary: Allows the user to transfer up to 10 Hit Points from their vitality network to themselves or a bonded creature.
annotation.prerequisites: requires a vitality network and a bonded creature

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to sense within 60 feet and transfer an increasing amount of energy or healing, functioning as if it had the void trait when interacting with creatures that possess void healing. The transfer amount scales by 10 points at levels 5, 10, 15, and 20.
annotation.prerequisites: none specified

annotation.summary: Describes how a mystic spellcaster performs spellcasting, emphasizing the thematic and sensory elements of their casting style, such as prayers, songs, gestures, or energy flows connecting them to allies.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a spellcaster (mystic archetype or class)

annotation.summary: The paragraph explains that a character can cast up to three 1st-rank spells per day, provided they know the spells through their spell repertoire. The number of daily casts is referred to as spell slots.
annotation.action_economy: Daily limit of three 1st-rank spell casts
annotation.prerequisites: Must know spells through the spell repertoire class feature

annotation.summary: Higher-level mystics gain access to more spell slots per day and can cast higher-rank spells, as detailed in the referenced table.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; describes progression rather than an action.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be a mystic and gain levels in the class.

annotation.summary: Explains how spell attacks and saving throw DCs are determined for a spellcaster whose key attribute is Wisdom, noting that both use the caster's Wisdom modifier.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; describes calculation of modifiers rather than an action.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have spells that require attack rolls or saving throws and use Wisdom as their key attribute.

annotation.summary: Describes how higher-rank spell slots can be used to cast stronger versions of lower-rank spells, known as heightening. The caster must know the spell at the desired rank, though some class features allow free heightening.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell; heightening does not change casting time.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to spell slots of 2nd rank or higher and knowledge of the spell at the desired rank.

annotation.summary: Cantrips are spells that can be cast without using spell slots and may be cast any number of times per day. Their effective rank automatically increases with the caster’s level, equal to half the caster’s level rounded up.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by specific cantrip; generally follows the casting time listed for the spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells or possess the cantrip feature from a class such as Mystic.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, you gain a spell repertoire containing two 1st-rank spells and four cantrips, plus one additional spell and cantrip from your chosen connection. You select these from the spell tradition linked to your connection or other accessible spells of that tradition. You can cast any spell in your repertoire using a spell slot of the appropriate rank.
annotation.action_economy: Casting a spell requires the normal casting time and actions for that spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be 1st level and have a chosen connection that determines spell tradition access.

annotation.summary: As the character gains levels and new spell slots, they add a new spell of the same rank to their spell repertoire.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a spell repertoire and gain a new spell slot through leveling.

annotation.summary: Describes how a spellcaster gains new spells as they advance in level, including automatically receiving connection-granted spells and choosing additional spells of appropriate rank, with the option to select heightened versions of known spells.
annotation.action_economy: None (applies during character advancement, not during combat)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a spellcaster with a chosen connection and access to new spell ranks

annotation.summary: Clarifies that spell slots and the spells in a character’s repertoire are distinct resources; gaining one does not grant the other.
annotation.prerequisites: ability to cast spells or have a spell repertoire

annotation.summary: When a character gains a level and learns new spells, they may replace one previously learned spell with another of the same rank, except for special spells such as epiphany or connection spells. Spell replacement can also occur through retraining during downtime.
annotation.action_economy: Occurs automatically on level-up or during downtime retraining; no combat action required.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a spellcaster with a spell repertoire and have gained a new level or access to downtime retraining.

annotation.summary: At every even-numbered level starting from 2nd, the character gains a mystic class feat, with details found on page 121.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be at least 2nd level in the mystic class.

annotation.summary: Starting at 2nd level and every two levels after, the character gains one skill feat, provided they are trained or better in the relevant skill.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be trained or better in the associated skill.

annotation.summary: Bonded creatures can telepathically communicate within 120 feet and sense each other's condition, direction, and distance as long as they are alive and on the same plane. The feature also grants the Network Spell action.
annotation.action_economy: Grants a new action: Network Spell
annotation.prerequisites: Requires creatures to be bonded and on the same plane of existence

annotation.summary: A mystic ability that requires concentration to maintain and involves shaping or altering magical energy.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration; likely uses an action or focus to maintain.
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess mystic training or class features that grant spellshaping abilities.

annotation.summary: Allows a caster to make their next spell originate from a bonded ally’s location instead of their own, using the ally’s position for range and area calculations while maintaining line of sight and effect from both caster and ally. The effect can disguise the spell’s source if the caster is hidden or the spell has the subtle trait.
annotation.action_economy: Free Action or part of the next Cast a Spell action (depends on system context)
prerequisites: Next action must be to Cast a Spell with an area, range, or target

annotation.summary: The character gains enhanced reflexes through divine insight, improving their proficiency rank in Reflex saves to expert.
annotation.prerequisites: Connection or class feature granting divine insight

annotation.summary: This feature allows a spellcaster to designate one spell per spell rank as a signature spell, which can be freely heightened or cast at lower ranks without needing to learn each version separately. Signature spells can be swapped or retrained for others of the same rank.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells of at least one rank

annotation.summary: The character strengthens their magical connection, improving their spellcasting accuracy and potency by increasing proficiency ranks for spell attacks and spell DCs to expert.
annotation.prerequisites: Existing connection or spellcasting proficiency

annotation.summary: Your spiritual bond strengthens your resolve, improving your Will saves to master proficiency and upgrading successful Will saves to critical successes.
The character becomes more vigilant, improving their Perception proficiency to the expert level.
annotation.prerequisites: trained in Perception

annotation.summary: The character becomes more skilled with basic weapons, gaining expert proficiency with simple weapons and unarmed attacks.
annotation.prerequisites: trained in simple weapons or unarmed attacks

annotation.summary: Grants bonus damage with weapons and unarmed attacks based on proficiency level: +2 for expert, +3 for master, and +4 for legendary.
annotation.prerequisites: Expert proficiency with a weapon or unarmed attacks

annotation.summary: The character enhances their magical connection, improving their proficiency with spell attacks and spell DCs to the master level.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an existing magical connection or spellcasting ability.

annotation.summary: A progression table showing the number of spell slots or spell ranks available to a character at each level, from level 1 to 20. It outlines how many spells of each rank (cantrips through 10th rank) a character can cast as they advance.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this table describes resource progression rather than actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have a spellcasting class or feature that uses this spell rank progression.

annotation.summary: The character attains complete understanding of their mystical connection, realizing its cosmic significance and achieving perfect harmony with it.
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess a chosen connection or similar class feature.

annotation.summary: The feature grants the character a single 10th-rank spell slot usable with mystic spellcasting. This slot cannot be affected by abilities that modify or grant additional spell slots. The character does not gain more 10th-rank slots through leveling, but may gain a second one by taking the Transcended Existence feat.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this feature modifies spell slot availability rather than requiring an action.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic spellcasting; may require eligibility for 10th-rank spells.

annotation.summary: Describes how a character’s mystical connection defines their source of magic, determines their spellcasting tradition, grants proficiency in a specific skill, and automatically adds connection spells to their spell repertoire.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have a class or feature that grants a mystical connection.

annotation.summary: At 1st level, the character gains an initial epiphany and their connection's harmony, which activates when they use the Transfer Vitality ability. Advanced and greater epiphanies can be obtained later through specific feats, and the perfect harmony feature is gained at 19th level.
annotation.prerequisites: 1st level for initial epiphany and harmony; Advanced Epiphany and Greater Epiphany feats for higher tiers; 19th level for perfect harmony

annotation.summary: The character possesses a lasting psychic connection to the Akashic Record, granting access to vast and otherwise unreachable knowledge.
annotation.prerequisites: must have innate or trained psychic ability to connect with the Akashic Record

annotation.summary: This entry designates the tradition as occult and identifies Occultism as the associated connection skill.
Lists the spells available through the Connection spell list, organized by spell level from cantrip to 9th level.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by individual spell; typically one action to cast unless otherwise noted.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Connection spell list or a class feature that grants Connection spells.

annotation.summary: Lists the progression of Epiphany Spells, starting with Akashic Fount as the initial spell, Akashic Assistant as the advanced spell, and Data Drain as the greater spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to Epiphany Spells feature or equivalent class ability

annotation.summary: Harmony allows a target of your Transfer Vitality ability to immediately attempt a Recall Knowledge check as a reaction, without triggering any effects tied to using Recall Knowledge.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use Transfer Vitality

annotation.summary: Introduces key terminology that frequently appears in mystic class features.

A spellshape action modifies a spell when used immediately before casting it. If any other action occurs between the spellshape and the spell, the modification is lost. The spellshape’s effects are treated as part of the spell’s outcome.
annotation.action_economy: Requires one action used immediately before casting a spell; no other actions (including free or reactions) can occur between the spellshape and the spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells and access to spellshape actions.

annotation.summary: During daily preparations, each phantasmal minion stored in your memory palace acts as an akashic assistant, similar to those produced by the Akashic Assistant epiphany spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to create or maintain a memory palace containing phantasmal minions

annotation.summary: The character draws upon elemental forces tied to the creation of the universe, reflecting a deep connection to one or more elements, and gains the Shield Block general feat.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified

annotation.summary: This entry defines a tradition associated with primal magic and identifies Nature as the related skill for checks or abilities tied to that tradition.
Lists the progression of spells granted by the Connection feature, from cantrip to 9th level, each representing elemental or energy-based effects.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell; typically standard or casting action depending on spell level.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Connection feature or class that grants Connection Spells.

annotation.summary: This rule instructs the player to substitute the elemental trait and damage type of an ability with those corresponding to their currently active elemental weapon or elemental barrier epiphany spell.
annotation.action_economy: None specified; this is a modification rule rather than an action.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an active elemental weapon or elemental barrier epiphany spell.

annotation.summary: The Epiphany Spells progression grants access to three spells at different tiers: Elemental Weapon at the initial level, Elemental Barrier at the advanced level, and Elemental Nova at the greater level.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell; each spell uses its own casting time as defined in its description.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires access to the Epiphany Spells feature or equivalent class ability.

annotation.summary: When you use Transfer Vitality, you select an elemental trait. If you have active elemental epiphanies, you must use the same element. The target’s next Strike before the end of their next turn deals damage of a type associated with that element instead of its normal damage type.
annotation.action_economy: Triggered as part of Transfer Vitality
prerequisites: May require active elemental epiphanies for specific elements

annotation.summary: During daily preparations, you select an elemental trait and gain resistance equal to half your level to its associated damage types. Choosing fire also grants resistance to cold. When you heal a bonded ally with Transfer Vitality, they gain the same resistances until your next turn.
annotation.action_economy: None (applies during daily preparations and when using Transfer Vitality)

annotation.summary: The character channels universal life and void energies to cast spells that can both heal allies and damage enemies.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell; typically requires a spellcasting action.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to manipulate or access life and void energies; spellcasting capability.

annotation.summary: This entry defines a divine tradition feature that uses Medicine as its associated skill.
Lists the progression of spells granted by the Connection feature, from cantrip to 9th level, each representing a thematic link to life, death, and vitality.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell; typically 1 standard action unless otherwise noted in individual spell descriptions.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Connection feature or class that grants these spells.

annotation.summary: A progression of epiphany spells that grant different abilities at increasing power levels: infusion (initial), vitality nova (advanced), and vital rebirth (greater).
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell level; each spell likely requires a standard casting action appropriate to its tier.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Epiphany spell list or class feature that grants these spells.

annotation.summary: When using the Transfer Vitality ability, you can also attempt to counteract one affliction or one effect causing specific negative conditions such as blindness, clumsiness, or sickness on the target.
annotation.action_economy: Triggered as part of Transfer Vitality
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use Transfer Vitality

annotation.summary: The character channels a cosmic rhythm called the Song of the Spheres, using music and vibrations to inspire or empower allies connected through a mystical bond.
annotation.action_economy: Varies; likely a standard or focus action depending on system context
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to channel or perform the Song of the Spheres; connection or bond with allies

annotation.summary: This entry defines a tradition as primal and associates it with the Performance skill for connection or related checks.
Lists the progression of Connection Spells from cantrip to 9th level, each themed around sound, music, or mental influence.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell level; typically one action to cast unless otherwise specified by the individual spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Connection spell list or class feature that grants Connection Spells.

annotation.summary: The Epiphany Spells feature grants access to three spells—anthem, shuffle, and remix—and provides a Harmony benefit that extends the duration of active epiphanies by 1 round whenever you use Transfer Vitality.
annotation.action_economy: Triggered when using Transfer Vitality; extends duration by 1 round.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have access to the Epiphany Spells feature and the ability to use Transfer Vitality.

annotation.summary: When you use Transfer Vitality for the first time in a round, the healed target can immediately take a free Stride action. This effect is categorized under the traversal trait.
annotation.action_economy: Free action (triggered by first Transfer Vitality each round)

annotation.summary: The character can manipulate shadows connected to the Netherworld, shaping them into various forms through supernatural control.
annotation.prerequisites: None stated

annotation.summary: This entry defines a divine tradition ability or feature that uses Stealth as its associated skill.
Lists the progression of spells granted by the Connection feature, starting from a cantrip and advancing through 1st to 9th level spells, each associated with illusion or shadow themes.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by individual spell; not specified in this entry.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Connection feature or class that grants these spells.

annotation.summary: A list of epiphany spells progressing in power: Shadow Snap as the initial spell, Cloying Shadows as the advanced spell, and Shadow Prison as the greater spell.
When you use Transfer Vitality, the target becomes surrounded by magical dim light that conceals them and can counteract other light sources until the end of your next turn.
annotation.action_economy: Occurs as part of using Transfer Vitality; lasts until the end of your next turn.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use Transfer Vitality.

annotation.summary: The paragraph instructs the reader to reference a table listing mystic feats organized by name.

A list of feats and abilities from a tabletop role-playing game, each associated with a level requirement. The entries suggest a progression of magical and bond-related powers, as well as enhancements to spellcasting and vitality.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; likely varies by individual feat.
annotation.prerequisites: Each feat appears to require a minimum character level as indicated by the number following its name.

annotation.summary: The Perfect Harmony feature grants the Umbral Stride action. When the user performs Transfer Vitality, the recipient gains a single use of Umbral Stride before their next turn ends.
annotation.action_economy: Grants an additional action (Umbral Stride) to the target after Transfer Vitality.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use Transfer Vitality.

annotation.summary: Allows the user to teleport up to 30 feet between areas of dim light or darkness that they can see and have line of effect to.
annotation.action_economy: varies (typically one action or part of movement, depending on system)
annotation.prerequisites: must have access to dim light or darkness at both origin and destination, and maintain line of sight and line of effect

annotation.summary: When a character gains a mystic feat level, they may choose one feat from a list, provided they meet all prerequisites.
annotation.prerequisites: Must meet the specific requirements of the chosen feat.

annotation.summary: The rule requires that the character have divine spellcasting abilities and actively worship a deity.

The feature grants a divine disciple training in their deity’s associated skill and adds specific cleric spells to their spell list and repertoire as signature spells. If already trained in that skill, the disciple may choose another skill to become trained in instead.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a disciple or follower of a deity

annotation.summary: A list of feats and abilities from a tabletop role-playing game, organized by level, focusing on magical, mental, and network-based powers that enhance casting, healing, and spiritual connection.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by feat; some modify spellcasting actions (e.g., Quickened Casting, Reach Spell, Widen Spell), while others provide passive or reaction-based benefits.
annotation.prerequisites: Each feat likely requires a specific level or class feature as indicated by the level numbers (e.g., level 1, 4, 6, 10, etc.) and possibly alignment with a magical or druidic tradition.

annotation.summary: A mystic ability that requires concentration to shape or modify a spell’s form or effects.
annotation.prerequisites: must have access to mystic spellshaping abilities

annotation.summary: Allows a caster to increase the range of their next spell by 30 feet, or to change a touch-range spell to a 30-foot range.
annotation.action_economy: 1 action or activity used before casting a spell
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells

annotation.summary: A mystic ability that requires concentration to maintain and involves shaping or altering magical energy or spells.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration; likely uses a standard or focus action depending on system specifics.
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess mystic training or class features that grant access to spellshaping abilities.

annotation.summary: The feature requires the character to have a connection with primal spellcasting before it can be used or selected.
annotation.prerequisites: Connection with primal spellcasting

annotation.summary: The feature grants training in a specific skill tied to the chosen order and adds certain spells to the character’s spell list and repertoire as signature spells. If the character already has training in that skill, additional benefits may apply (not shown in the excerpt).
annotation.prerequisites: must belong to or select an order

annotation.summary: The character is a devotee of the Newborn, an outer god associated with change, who channels eldritch magic to heal allies.
annotation.prerequisites: Must worship the Newborn

annotation.summary: The paragraph advises prioritizing Wisdom as the main attribute, followed by Dexterity, with additional points in Constitution for increased health and Strength to handle an aucturnite chakram.
A list of abilities or features available at specific levels: Healing, Eldritch Bond at 2nd level, Mental Interference at 4th level, and Vitality Web at 16th level.
annotation.prerequisites: Character level thresholds (2nd, 4th, and 16th levels)

annotation.summary: Lists the 1st-level spells and cantrips available, including healing, psychic attack, protective, and utility options.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell; typically 1 or 2 actions depending on the specific spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level spells or cantrips from the relevant spellcasting class.

annotation.summary: An Animal order granting access to Animal Lore skill and specific transformation spells at various levels.
annotation.prerequisites: Must follow the Animal order or have access to its teachings.

annotation.summary: A character option tied to the Plant order, granting access to Plant Lore skill and specific nature-themed spells at various levels.
A Viral-themed magical order focused on genealogy and disease, granting access to poison- and virus-related spells.
Allows the character to learn two extra cantrips from their spell list, expanding their available simple spells.
annotation.prerequisites: ability to cast cantrips or have a spell list

annotation.summary: A mystic ability that requires concentration to maintain and involves shaping or altering magical energy.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration; likely uses a standard or focus action depending on system context.
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess mystic training or class features that grant access to spellshaping abilities.

annotation.summary: By focusing your mind, you can make your spellcasting nearly imperceptible. The next spell you cast gains the subtle trait, concealing the visible and audible signs of casting but not the spell's resulting effects.
annotation.action_economy: 1 action (applies to the next Cast a Spell action)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells

annotation.summary: The ability or feature requires the character to have a connection with occult spellcasting before it can be used or selected.
annotation.prerequisites: Connection with occult spellcasting

annotation.summary: The character channels their own life energy to restore or empower a bonded ally by transferring vitality.
The feature requires the character to have a connection with primal spellcasting before it can be used.
annotation.prerequisites: Connection with primal spellcasting

annotation.summary: A magical technique or spellshape that requires focus and manipulates emotions or mental states through mystic power.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration or a focused action to maintain or activate.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use mystic or spellshape powers; training in mental or emotional manipulation.

annotation.summary: When you ready your vitality network before casting a damaging spell, you and a bonded ally gain temporary resistance to one of the spell’s damage types equal to its rank until the end of your next turn.
annotation.action_economy: Requires preparation before casting a damaging spell; effect applies after the next Cast a Spell action.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a bonded ally and the ability to Cast a Spell that deals damage.

annotation.summary: Allows the user to store and retrieve items in an extradimensional space linked to their vitality network. Items up to 1 Bulk can be stowed with an Interact action, and bonded creatures on the same plane can retrieve items with a 2-action Interact. The storage capacity scales with level.
prerequisites: bonded creature on same plane for shared access

annotation.summary: The ability allows a character to sense and connect with their bonded allies at any distance, and to transfer vitality to them as long as they are on the same planet.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; likely a special or free action depending on system context.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires a bonded ally connection.

annotation.summary: You attempt to mentally link with a visible foe within 30 feet, making a skill check using your connection skill against their Will DC. On success, you share a confusing mental glimpse, and the target becomes temporarily immune for 1 hour.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a connection skill and a visible foe within 30 feet

annotation.summary: A mystic ability that requires concentration to shape or alter a spell’s form or effects.
prerequisites: must be able to cast mystic spells

annotation.summary: When you next cast a void-damage spell on a living creature, your vitality network restores Hit Points equal to twice the spell's rank.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a preceding focus action; effect triggers on the next Cast a Spell action.
prerequisites: Ability to use a vitality network

annotation.summary: Allows the character to use Waste Not without the spellshape trait, granting their vitality network 2 Hit Points per weapon damage die if their next action is a Strike with a void-damage weapon.
annotation.action_economy: Triggered when using Waste Not followed by a Strike action.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be able to use Waste Not; next action must be a Strike with a void-damage weapon.

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to convert their vitality network energy into a protective shield, granting temporary resistance equal to twice their level against a single attack or effect, after which the vitality network is reduced by the amount of damage prevented.
prerequisites: must have a vitality network resource

annotation.summary: Requires the character to be an expert in a connection skill that is different from their chosen connection.
annotation.prerequisites: Expert in a connection skill other than the chosen connection

annotation.summary: The character gains access to the initial epiphany spell from another cosmic connection, provided they meet the skill training requirement for that connection.
annotation.prerequisites: Training in the skill associated with the chosen connection

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to distribute transferred Hit Points among multiple bonded allies, but the total amount of Hit Points that can be transferred remains unchanged.
The character enhances their bond with their chosen connection, gaining access to the advanced epiphany spell associated with it.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a chosen connection.

annotation.summary: A mystic ability that influences or alters the emotions or mental state of a target through supernatural or psychic means.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on specific ability; typically a standard or focus action.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires access to mystic or psychic powers capable of emotional or mental influence.

annotation.summary: The ability or feature requires the character to have a connection with occult spellcasting before it can be used.
annotation.prerequisites: Connection with occult spellcasting

annotation.summary: Allows communication with computers and treats summoned construct creatures as part of your bond without counting toward the normal limit. During daily preparations, you select one spell from a specified list related to constructs or technology.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to form a bond with creatures or access to construct-related magic

annotation.summary: Temporarily adds a chosen spell to the character's spell repertoire and signature spells until the next daily preparations.
annotation.prerequisites: ability to cast spells and maintain a spell repertoire

annotation.summary: The feature requires the character to have a connection with primal spellcasting before it can be used or selected.
annotation.prerequisites: Connection with primal spellcasting

annotation.summary: Allows communication with animals and plants, expands the bond to include summoned creatures without limit, and grants temporary access to one chosen summon spell each day.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to form a bond with creatures; access to spell repertoire and signature spells

annotation.summary: The character attains deeper cosmic insight through their connection, gaining access to the greater epiphany spell associated with that connection.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a chosen connection feature

annotation.summary: Allows a caster to reduce the number of actions required to cast a mystic cantrip or a lower-rank mystic spell by one, with a minimum of one action.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have mystic spell slots; next action must be to cast a mystic cantrip or a mystic spell at least 2 ranks lower than the highest mystic spell slot available.

annotation.summary: This ability activates when an enemy's elemental attack fails against your bonded creature or when you critically succeed on a saving throw against a harmful elemental spell.
prerequisites: enemy must use an elemental attack or spell

annotation.summary: When activated, the character's vitality network restores a small amount of Hit Points based on the strength of the triggering attack—either by spell rank or weapon damage dice.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires a vitality network feature or ability that can respond to incoming attacks.

annotation.summary: The vitality network restores Hit Points based on the spell rank of magical darkness, with doubled recovery if the area was originally bright light. After the magical darkness ends, the area remains in non-magical darkness for 1 minute, which can be dispelled by any magical light source.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; effect occurs as part of the magical darkness resolution.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an active magical darkness effect and an area with a defined light level (dim or bright).

annotation.summary: The ability allows a character to perform a Recall Knowledge check on an observed enemy. Success restores 10 Hit Points to the user's vitality network, and a critical success restores 20 Hit Points.
prerequisites: Access to vitality network or Akashic connection

annotation.summary: A character can restore their vitality network by willingly sacrificing an equal amount of their own Hit Points.
annotation.action_economy: Requires extreme concentration; likely a full-round or focused action depending on system context.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to use or possess a vitality network.

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to move multiple times and convert that movement into healing energy, restoring health based on the number of strides taken.
annotation.action_economy: Uses a variable number of actions; the number of strides equals the actions spent.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires access to a vitality network or similar magical healing feature.

annotation.summary: Spells that deal damage or restore Hit Points without a duration gain a status bonus to their effect equal to the spell's rank.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability or feature that modifies spells based on their rank

annotation.summary: Allows the caster to apply one known spellshape feat to a spell that currently lacks a spellshape effect, provided the feat is compatible and available for use.
annotation.action_economy: Triggered or part of spellcasting (no separate action specified)
annotation.prerequisites: Must know at least one spellshape feat and meet its usage conditions

annotation.summary: You can empower a spell by spending vitality equal to twice its rank. If you cast that spell next, one bonded ally affected by it becomes quickened until the end of your next turn, gaining an extra action usable only for Stride or Strike.
annotation.action_economy: Requires an action to infuse magic; the next action must be casting the chosen spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a vitality network and a bonded ally target for the spell.

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to automatically sustain one of their currently active mystic spells without spending an action.
annotation.action_economy: Free or automatic action that grants the effect of a Sustain action for one active mystic spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have at least one active mystic spell.

annotation.summary: Requires mastery in a connection skill tied to a learned initial epiphany that is not the character's chosen connection.
annotation.prerequisites: Master in a connection skill for a connection with an initial epiphany learned, excluding the chosen connection.

annotation.summary: The character deepens their understanding of their mystical connection, gaining access to an advanced epiphany spell associated with that connection, which also provides training in the required connection skill.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a connection and meet the skill training requirement for that connection.

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to channel their shared vitality network, letting each ally either draw up to 20 Hit Points from the network or contribute up to 20 Hit Points to it.
annotation.action_economy: Immediate or reaction-based effect affecting all allies simultaneously
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an established vitality network and allied participants

annotation.summary: The ability requires the character to have achieved a legendary level in their connection skill.
annotation.prerequisites: Legendary proficiency in the connection skill

annotation.summary: The character can substitute 20 Hit Points from their vitality network in place of a Focus Point when casting an epiphany spell, reflecting their deep metaphysical connection.
annotation.action_economy: applies when the next action is casting an epiphany spell
annotation.prerequisites: must possess a vitality network and the ability to cast epiphany spells

annotation.summary: The ability requires the character to have achieved a legendary level in their connection skill.
annotation.prerequisites: Legendary proficiency in the connection skill

annotation.summary: The character enhances their vitality network, increasing its maximum capacity to 200 Hit Points, improving regeneration to 20 Hit Points per turn, and allowing bonding with any number of willing creatures.
annotation.action_economy: Passive effect; regeneration occurs automatically at the start of each turn.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires prior establishment of a vitality network or similar connection ability.

annotation.summary: The feature grants the character an extra 10th-rank spell slot, representing a superior magical connection beyond normal limits.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 10th-rank spells or equivalent class feature
